title: Drawing, "Sketches for a gateway for a prison erected by Pope Pius VI"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, red ink
markings:
Watermark: Bird over triple mount flanked by D G, in ovoid; on top: crown
Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457e)
inscribed:
Inscribed in the frieze: PIVS VI P M FECIT A[nno]
Inscribed in the front side of the pedestal: PVI
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Top right: an elevation. A rustic arch, the pilasters of which stand before wall panels, supports the entablature. The angular pediment topped by a Papal escutcheon before an attic. Flanking walls indicated. Bottom row: an elevation. Rustic doorway with a triangular pediment, topped by a high pedestal supporting a Papal escuthcheon. The door is flanked by couped cones with lanterns and domes on top. Sketches for the attic of the upper design. The left angle of the pediment. Colored background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Sketches for a gateway for a prison erected by Pope Pius VI".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, red ink. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1073.
